title: Deuteronomy Chapter 23 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Deuteronomy chapter 23 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 23 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Deuteronomy Chapter 23.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 23:1, who shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD?
options: He that is wounded in the stones or hath his privy member cut off
questions.correctAnswer: He that is wounded in the stones or hath his privy member cut off
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:1 states that he who is wounded in the stones or has his privy member cut off shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD.

questions.question: How many generations of a bastard are forbidden to enter into the congregation of the LORD (Deuteronomy 23:2)?
questions.correctAnswer: Ten generations
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:2 says a bastard shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD even to his tenth generation.

questions.question: Which nations are forbidden from entering the congregation of the LORD according to Deuteronomy 23:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Ammonite and Moabite
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:3 specifies that an Ammonite or Moabite shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD to their tenth generation forever.

questions.question: Why were the Ammonites and Moabites excluded from the congregation according to Deuteronomy 23:4?
options: Because they did not meet you with bread and water and hired Balaam to curse you
Because they were descendants of Canaan
questions.correctAnswer: Because they did not meet you with bread and water and hired Balaam to curse you
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:4 explains their exclusion was because they did not meet the Israelites with bread and water and hired Balaam to curse them.

questions.question: What did the LORD do to Balaam's curse according to Deuteronomy 23:5?
options: Turned the curse into a blessing
questions.correctAnswer: Turned the curse into a blessing
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:5 states that the LORD turned the curse of Balaam into a blessing because He loved Israel.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 23:7 commands not to abhor an Edomite because he is your brother.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:7 explicitly says you shall not abhor an Edomite for he is your brother.

questions.question: In which generation shall children of Edomites and Egyptians be allowed to enter into the congregation of the LORD (Deuteronomy 23:8)?
questions.correctAnswer: Third generation
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:8 states that children begotten of Edomites and Egyptians shall enter into the congregation in their third generation.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 23:10, where must a man go if he is unclean by reason of uncleanness that happens by night?
options: Go abroad out of the camp
questions.correctAnswer: Go abroad out of the camp
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:10 directs that such a man shall go abroad out of the camp and not come within it until evening.

questions.question: What must a man do in the evening after being unclean during the day according to Deuteronomy 23:11?
options: Wash himself with water and return to the camp when the sun is down
Stay outside the camp all night
questions.correctAnswer: Wash himself with water and return to the camp when the sun is down
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:11 states he shall wash himself when evening comes and then can reenter the camp after sunset.

questions.question: What tool is commanded to be carried on a weapon for digging and covering waste in Deuteronomy 23:13?
questions.correctAnswer: A paddle
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:13 commands having a paddle upon your weapon to dig and cover what comes from you when you ease yourself abroad.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 23:15 instructs to deliver escaped servants back to their masters.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:15 commands not to deliver the servant who has escaped to you back to his master.

questions.question: Where shall an escaped servant dwell according to Deuteronomy 23:16?
options: In the place he shall choose in one of your gates
In the fields outside the city
In the homes of the priests
questions.correctAnswer: In the place he shall choose in one of your gates
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:16 says the escaped servant shall dwell where he chooses in one of your gates and you shall not oppress him.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 23:17 states there shall be no whore or sodomite among the children of Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:17 clearly states there shall be no whore of the daughters of Israel nor a sodomite of the sons of Israel.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Deuteronomy 23:19: 'Thou shalt not lend upon usury to thy _______'
questions.correctAnswer: brother
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:19 instructs not to lend upon usury to your brother.

questions.question: What is permitted when you enter your neighbor's vineyard according to Deuteronomy 23:24?
options: Eat grapes thy fill, but do not put any in thy vessel
Pick and carry away grapes in a basket
questions.correctAnswer: Eat grapes thy fill, but do not put any in thy vessel
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:24 allows eating grapes freely but forbids putting any in your vessel when in your neighbor's vineyard.

medium.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 23 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Deuteronomy Chapter 23 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 23 teach us about holiness and purity in the community of believers when facing spiritual challenges?
options: Keep away from anything unclean during times of battle
Ignore ceremonial cleanliness during difficult times
Accept all without regard to purity
questions.correctAnswer: Keep away from anything unclean during times of battle
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:9-10 instructs believers to keep themselves from every wicked thing when the army goes out against enemies and to separate if unclean, highlighting the importance of holiness and purity in community life.

questions.question: What principle about generosity and contentment can we learn from Deuteronomy 23:24-25 about interacting with a neighbor's produce?
options: You may eat freely but must not take away in containers
You may harvest the entire field with a sickle
You may take grapes and carry them away in vessels
You must not eat anything from your neighbor's property
questions.correctAnswer: You may eat freely but must not take away in containers
questions.explanation: Verses 24-25 teach that one may eat grapes or pluck ears of grain by hand in a neighbor's field but should not gather them in containers or use a sickle, emphasizing respect, moderation, and contentment.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with fulfilling promises made to God. Based on Deuteronomy 23, what biblical truth would you share about vows?
options: You must keep your vows to God without delay
It is acceptable to neglect vows if inconvenient
Vows to God are optional and not serious
Only public vows need to be kept
questions.correctAnswer: You must keep your vows to God without delay
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:21-23 stresses that vows made to the LORD must be fulfilled promptly and faithfully, as failing to do so is considered sin, teaching integrity and obedience.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 23, how should believers treat escaped servants seeking refuge?
options: Do not return them to their masters and do not oppress them
Return them immediately to their masters
questions.correctAnswer: Do not return them to their masters and do not oppress them
questions.explanation: Verses 15-16 teach that escaped servants should be allowed to dwell freely and not be oppressed, highlighting mercy and justice within the community.

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 23 teach about lending to fellow believers versus strangers?
options: Lend to brothers without interest but may charge strangers interest
Lend only to strangers without interest
questions.correctAnswer: Lend to brothers without interest but may charge strangers interest
questions.explanation: Verses 19-20 instruct believers not to lend to their brothers with usury but allow lending to strangers at interest, encouraging generosity and fairness within the community.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 23 address the issue of bringing dishonest offerings into the house of the LORD?
options: Do not bring the wages of a prostitute or the price of a dog as offerings
All money can be offered to God regardless of source
Offerings from any source are acceptable
questions.correctAnswer: Do not bring the wages of a prostitute or the price of a dog as offerings
questions.explanation: Verse 18 warns that the earnings of immoral or dishonorable work are abominations to the LORD and must not be brought as vows, teaching integrity in worship.

questions.question: True or False: According to Deuteronomy 23, an Ammonite or Moabite is permitted to enter the congregation of the LORD at any generation.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 3 clearly states that Ammonites and Moabites shall not enter the congregation of the LORD even to their tenth generation, emphasizing separation based on historical disobedience.

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 23 teach about humility and remembrance of past kindness towards foreigners?
options: Do not abhor Egyptians because you were once strangers in their land
Ignore past kindness shown by foreigners
questions.correctAnswer: Do not abhor Egyptians because you were once strangers in their land
questions.explanation: Verse 7 instructs not to abhor Egyptians due to the Israelites' history as strangers in their land, teaching humility and gratitude.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 23 guide believers in maintaining cleanliness and respect for God's presence in their camp?
options: Designate a place outside the camp for sanitation and cover waste
Ignore sanitation and cleanliness in camp
Allow unclean individuals to stay freely within the camp
Focus only on physical weapons for protection
questions.correctAnswer: Designate a place outside the camp for sanitation and cover waste
questions.explanation: Verses 12-14 instruct the community to have a place outside the camp for waste with a paddle to cover it, because the LORD walks in the camp and the camp must be holy.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Deuteronomy 23:1 teaches that a man who is __________ or hath his privy member cut off shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD.
questions.correctAnswer: wounded in the stones
questions.explanation: Verse 1 states that a man wounded in the stones or with his privy member cut off shall not enter the LORD's congregation, emphasizing physical wholeness in ceremonial participation.

questions.question: A believer asks about God's protection and presence during community challenges. What does Deuteronomy 23:14 teach about God's role in the camp?
options: The LORD walks in the midst of the camp to deliver and give up enemies
The camp is protected by human strength only
God punishes the camp for any unclean thing
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD walks in the midst of the camp to deliver and give up enemies
questions.explanation: Verse 14 assures that God Himself walks among the camp to protect and defeat enemies, encouraging trust and holiness among the people.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 23, how should believers handle the practice of usury among themselves?
options: Do not charge interest to your brother
Charge interest to your brother but not strangers
questions.correctAnswer: Do not charge interest to your brother
questions.explanation: Verses 19-20 instruct not to lend with interest to fellow Israelites but allow lending with interest to strangers, promoting fairness and brotherly love.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 23 commands that there shall be no harlot or sodomite among the people of Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 17 explicitly states that there shall be no harlot of the daughters of Israel nor sodomite of the sons of Israel, reflecting the call to moral purity.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 23:22 guide believers regarding making vows to God?
options: Not making a vow is not sinful
It is sinful to refrain from making vows
Vows can be broken without consequence
questions.correctAnswer: Not making a vow is not sinful
questions.explanation: Verse 22 teaches that if one refrains from making a vow, it is not sin, highlighting freedom in voluntary commitment but seriousness when vows are made.

questions.question: What practical instruction about personal hygiene and communal respect is given in Deuteronomy 23 when someone experiences nocturnal uncleanness?
options: The person must leave the camp and wash before returning in the evening
The person may stay in the camp without washing
The person must be excommunicated permanently
The person should hide their uncleanness
questions.correctAnswer: The person must leave the camp and wash before returning in the evening
questions.explanation: Verses 10-11 instruct that one unclean by nocturnal emissions must leave the camp and wash before re-entering, teaching respect for holiness and communal purity.

hard.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 23 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Deuteronomy Chapter 23.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 23:1, who is prohibited from entering the congregation of the LORD?
options: He that is wounded in the stones or hath his privy member cut off
questions.correctAnswer: He that is wounded in the stones or hath his privy member cut off
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:1 explicitly states that one who is wounded in the stones or has his privy member cut off shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD, indicating a physical condition disqualifying entry.

questions.question: What is the generational limit placed on a bastard entering the congregation of the LORD as stated in Deuteronomy 23:2?
questions.correctAnswer: To his tenth generation
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:2 forbids a bastard from entering the congregation of the LORD even to his tenth generation, showing a long-term exclusion based on lineage.

questions.question: Deuteronomy 23:3 forbids the Ammonite and Moabite from entering the congregation for how long?
options: Forever, even to their tenth generation
questions.correctAnswer: Forever, even to their tenth generation
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly says they shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD forever, even to their tenth generation, indicating permanent exclusion.

questions.question: Why were the Ammonites and Moabites excluded, according to Deuteronomy 23:4?
options: Because they did not meet Israel with bread and water and hired Balaam to curse them
Because they were descendants of Esau
questions.correctAnswer: Because they did not meet Israel with bread and water and hired Balaam to curse them
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:4 explains their exclusion is due to their failure to assist Israel with bread and water during the journey and for hiring Balaam to curse Israel.

questions.question: What was the LORD's response to Balaam's attempt to curse Israel, as described in Deuteronomy 23:5?
options: The LORD turned the curse into a blessing
The LORD allowed the curse to succeed
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD turned the curse into a blessing
questions.explanation: The verse states that although Balaam was hired to curse Israel, the LORD would not hearken unto him but turned the curse into a blessing because of His love for Israel.

questions.question: Deuteronomy 23:6 commands Israel never to seek what from the Ammonites and Moabites?
questions.correctAnswer: Their peace nor their prosperity
questions.explanation: The verse commands that Israel must not seek peace or prosperity for these nations all their days, indicating a perpetual enmity.

questions.question: Which two nations does Deuteronomy 23:7 explicitly instruct Israel not to abhor, and why?
options: Edomite and Egyptian, because Edomites are brothers and Egyptians hosted Israel as strangers
Ammonites and Moabites, because they are neighbors
Canaanites and Philistines, because they lived nearby
Babylonians and Assyrians, because they were powerful
questions.correctAnswer: Edomite and Egyptian, because Edomites are brothers and Egyptians hosted Israel as strangers
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:7 explains Israel must not abhor Edomites as brothers and Egyptians because Israel was once strangers in Egypt.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 23:8, in which generation may the children of Edomites and Egyptians enter the congregation of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: In their third generation
questions.explanation: The children begotten of Edomites and Egyptians may enter the congregation in the third generation, indicating a lesser restriction than with Ammonites and Moabites.

questions.question: What instruction is given about cleanliness when the host goes out against enemies in Deuteronomy 23:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Keep from every wicked thing
questions.explanation: The verse commands that when the army goes out against enemies, they must abstain from all wickedness to maintain holiness.

questions.question: What is the prescribed protocol for a man who becomes unclean by nocturnal emission according to Deuteronomy 23:10-11?
options: He must go outside the camp until evening, then wash and re-enter
He must stay in the camp but avoid the altar
He must fast for three days
He must leave the camp permanently
questions.correctAnswer: He must go outside the camp until evening, then wash and re-enter
questions.explanation: Verses 10-11 specify that the unclean man must leave the camp and return only after washing himself in the evening, symbolizing ritual purification.

questions.question: Deuteronomy 23:12-13 instructs the camp to have a place outside for what purpose?
options: To relieve oneself and cover the waste with a paddle
questions.correctAnswer: To relieve oneself and cover the waste with a paddle
questions.explanation: These verses instruct the Israelites to designate a place outside the camp to relieve themselves and to use a paddle to cover their excrement, maintaining the camp's holiness.

questions.question: Why must the camp be holy according to Deuteronomy 23:14?
options: Because the LORD walks in the midst of the camp to deliver Israel
Because it is the dwelling place of the priests
Because it is on holy ground
Because sacrifices are offered there daily
questions.correctAnswer: Because the LORD walks in the midst of the camp to deliver Israel
questions.explanation: Verse 14 states the LORD walks among the camp to deliver Israel and defeat enemies, so the camp must be holy and free from unclean things.

questions.question: What is the command concerning an escaped servant found in Deuteronomy 23:15-16?
options: Do not return him to his master and let him dwell where he chooses
Return him immediately to his master
questions.correctAnswer: Do not return him to his master and let him dwell where he chooses
questions.explanation: These verses instruct that an escaped servant must not be delivered back but allowed to live freely in any place of the community without oppression.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 23:17 forbids both prostitution and sodomy among the children of Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 17 clearly states there shall be no whore of the daughters of Israel nor a sodomite of the sons of Israel, forbidding these practices.

questions.question: Which type of lending is prohibited among brothers according to Deuteronomy 23:19-20?
questions.correctAnswer: Lending with usury
questions.explanation: The passage forbids lending with interest (usury) to brothers but allows it to strangers, underscoring social ethics in Israel.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 23:24-25, what is permitted when entering a neighbor's vineyard or standing grain?
options: Eat grapes or pluck ears by hand but do not gather or use a sickle
Take as much as you want to store
questions.correctAnswer: Eat grapes or pluck ears by hand but do not gather or use a sickle
questions.explanation: These verses allow Israelite travelers to eat from a neighbor’s vineyard or field by hand but forbid collecting or harvesting with tools, reflecting respect for property.

theological.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 23 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Deuteronomy Chapter 23 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 23:1, who is forbidden from entering the congregation of the LORD?
options: He that is wounded in the stones or hath his privy member cut off
A man who has committed murder
A man who has not been circumcised
questions.correctAnswer: He that is wounded in the stones or hath his privy member cut off
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:1 explicitly states that those wounded in the stones or having their privy member cut off shall not enter the congregation of the LORD. This reflects the Old Testament emphasis on ritual purity (Leviticus 21:17-23; 1 Corinthians 7:18-19; Matthew 19:12; Ezekiel 44:7).

questions.question: Deuteronomy 23:2 forbids which group from entering the congregation of the LORD up to the tenth generation?
questions.correctAnswer: A bastard
questions.explanation: The verse forbids a bastard from entering the congregation of the LORD to the tenth generation, emphasizing the importance of legitimate lineage in covenant community (Deuteronomy 23:2; Ezra 9:2; Hebrews 12:8; John 1:12-13; 1 Corinthians 12:13).

questions.question: Why are Ammonites and Moabites forbidden from entering the congregation of the LORD forever, according to Deuteronomy 23:3-4?
options: Because they did not provide bread and water to the Israelites and hired Balaam to curse them
Because they were descended from Canaan
Because they attacked Israel in battle
questions.correctAnswer: Because they did not provide bread and water to the Israelites and hired Balaam to curse them
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:3-4 states that Ammonites and Moabites are excluded because they did not meet Israel with bread and water and because they hired Balaam to curse Israel. This shows God's justice and covenant faithfulness (Numbers 22-24; Judges 11:12-40; Romans 9:13; Revelation 2:14; Exodus 23:4-5).

questions.question: Despite the curse intended by Balaam, what did the LORD do for Israel according to Deuteronomy 23:5?
options: Turned the curse into a blessing
Allowed the curse to take effect
questions.correctAnswer: Turned the curse into a blessing
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:5 highlights God's sovereign protection and love, turning Balaam's curse into a blessing. This prefigures God's redemptive work and covenant faithfulness (Numbers 23:8-12; Genesis 12:3; Romans 8:28; 2 Corinthians 12:9; James 1:2-4).

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 23:7-8, which nations' descendants are allowed to enter the congregation of the LORD in the third generation?
questions.correctAnswer: Edomites and Egyptians
questions.explanation: The passage in 23:7-8 states that the children of Edomites and Egyptians shall enter the congregation in the third generation, showing God's mercy and recognition of kinship and hospitality (Genesis 15:13-16; Exodus 12:40-41; Ruth 4:13-17; Matthew 1:5; Galatians 3:28).

questions.question: What is the command concerning uncleanness at night and entry into the camp as given in Deuteronomy 23:10-11?
options: A man who becomes unclean by night must leave the camp, wash at evening, and then may return
A man must remain unclean within the camp until morning
A man must be purified by fire before reentering the camp
A man must be anointed with oil before reentering the camp
questions.correctAnswer: A man who becomes unclean by night must leave the camp, wash at evening, and then may return
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:10-11 commands ritual separation for uncleanness incurred by nocturnal emission, with reentry after washing at evening. This underscores holiness and separation (Leviticus 15:16-18; Numbers 5:2-3; Ezekiel 22:26; Hebrews 12:14; 1 Corinthians 6:18-20).

questions.question: What is the purpose of having a place outside the camp and a paddle for digging as instructed in Deuteronomy 23:12-13?
options: To maintain the camp’s holiness by properly disposing of human waste
To prepare the ground for planting crops
questions.correctAnswer: To maintain the camp’s holiness by properly disposing of human waste
questions.explanation: The instructions in 23:12-13 serve to keep the camp clean and holy because God dwells among His people, emphasizing purity and order (Deuteronomy 23:14; Leviticus 11:44-45; Numbers 19:13; Psalm 15:1-5; 1 Corinthians 3:16-17).

questions.question: What reason does Deuteronomy 23:14 give for keeping the camp holy?
options: Because the LORD thy God walks in the midst of thy camp to deliver thee
Because it is close to the temple
questions.correctAnswer: Because the LORD thy God walks in the midst of thy camp to deliver thee
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 23:14 shows God's intimate presence among His people in the camp, requiring holiness. This prefigures the New Testament teaching of God’s indwelling presence (Exodus 25:8; Psalm 46:5; John 14:16-17; 1 Corinthians 6:19; Revelation 21:3).

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 23:15-16 command regarding an escaped servant?
options: Do not deliver the escaped servant back to his master; let him dwell where he chooses
Return the servant immediately to his master
questions.correctAnswer: Do not deliver the escaped servant back to his master; let him dwell where he chooses
questions.explanation: These verses reveal God's justice and mercy by protecting vulnerable persons, reflecting the dignity and refuge God offers (Deuteronomy 23:15-16; Exodus 23:9; Isaiah 1:17; Luke 4:18; Hebrews 13:2).

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 23:17, what is forbidden among the daughters and sons of Israel?
options: There shall be no whore among the daughters nor a sodomite among the sons
They shall not eat unclean animals
questions.correctAnswer: There shall be no whore among the daughters nor a sodomite among the sons
questions.explanation: This prohibition in 23:17 emphasizes sexual holiness as part of covenant purity, consistent with Old Testament moral laws and New Testament teachings on holiness (Leviticus 18:22; 1 Corinthians 6:9-11; Romans 1:26-27; Ephesians 5:3; Hebrews 13:4).

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 23:18 say about bringing the hire of a prostitute or the price of a dog into the house of the LORD?
options: It is an abomination and must not be brought for any vow
It is acceptable if given as a freewill offering
It is allowed only during festivals
questions.correctAnswer: It is an abomination and must not be brought for any vow
questions.explanation: This verse condemns using ill-gotten gains or immoral earnings for worship, highlighting the need for purity in offerings (Leviticus 18:21; Proverbs 3:9; Malachi 1:6-14; Matthew 5:23-24; 1 Corinthians 10:31).

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 23:19 command about lending upon usury to a brother?
options: Do not lend upon usury to thy brother
Lend upon usury freely to all
Lend upon usury only to strangers
Lend only small amounts without interest
questions.correctAnswer: Do not lend upon usury to thy brother
questions.explanation: The prohibition against usury among brothers reflects God's concern for justice and compassion within the covenant community (Exodus 22:25; Leviticus 25:35-37; Psalm 15:5; Luke 6:34-35; James 5:4).

questions.question: When is it permissible to lend with interest according to Deuteronomy 23:20?
options: To a stranger, but not to thy brother
To a brother, but not to a stranger
questions.correctAnswer: To a stranger, but not to thy brother
questions.explanation: This verse shows a distinction in lending practices between fellow Israelites and foreigners, encouraging brotherly love and blessing (Deuteronomy 23:19-20; Exodus 22:25; Nehemiah 5:7-10; Luke 6:34-35; Romans 13:8).

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 23:21 say about vows made unto the LORD?
options: Thou shalt not slack to pay it, for it will be sin if neglected
Thou mayest delay payment without sin
Vows are optional and not required
Vows can be transferred to another person
questions.correctAnswer: Thou shalt not slack to pay it, for it will be sin if neglected
questions.explanation: The seriousness of vows is emphasized here, teaching integrity and reverence for God’s name (Ecclesiastes 5:4-5; Numbers 30:2; Matthew 5:33-37; James 5:12; Psalm 76:11).

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 23:23, what must a person do with their freewill offerings and vows?
options: Keep and perform them as promised to the LORD
Give them only if requested by a priest
questions.correctAnswer: Keep and perform them as promised to the LORD
questions.explanation: This stresses the importance of faithfulness and obedience to God’s commandments regarding vows and offerings (Numbers 30:2; Psalm 50:14; Matthew 23:23; Hebrews 10:22-25; 1 Samuel 1:11).

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 23:24 permit when entering a neighbor's vineyard?
options: Eat grapes to your fill but do not put any in your vessel
Harvest the entire vineyard for yourself
Take grapes and carry them away
questions.correctAnswer: Eat grapes to your fill but do not put any in your vessel
questions.explanation: This law promotes respect for others’ property while allowing for limited benefit, showing God’s concern for neighborly justice (Leviticus 19:9-10; Ruth 2:17; Proverbs 3:27; Matthew 7:12; Luke 10:27).
